metadata.synopsis: Dialog with Mystic Carrion, a mummy lord hiding in the Lower City. Players who carry the Necromancy of Thay (unread) have the chance to take part in a seance where they can learn how the book can be opened. Players can also take on a quest from Carrion, to bring back his runaway zombie beggar Thrumbo (potentially in exchange for the torch of revocation, intended to help Oskar).Various conclusions are available for the quest to help Mystic Carrion - if the player succeeds in bringing himThrumbo's torso, he will reward them with a Torch of revocation which can be used to cure Oskar's possession (Oskar's Beloved). If you refuse him, he will attack you, and keep returnign from the dead until you destroy his canopic jar (hidden inside Thrumbo)
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to Father Carrion in Philsgrave's Mansion in CTY_Main_Aloadlevel CTY_Main_Agoto -3.404; 11.065; -160.435

8.speaker: Mystic Carrion
8.text: First you butcher my staff, then you dare to enter my salon without an appointment.
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion stands still, almost trance-like at his throne. The player approaches, but he does not seem aware of their presence, then - BANG. He slams his staff on the ground.NodeContext: annoyed, but not overly so. A minor inconvenience

42.speaker: Mystic Carrion
42.text: What possible reason could you have to enter the presence of Mystic Carrion?
42.context: NodeContext: Powerful/compelling -  a hard to resist instruction

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I'd like to learn what the spirits know about 'The Necromancy of Thay'. [GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])
6.context: NodeContext: Correcting you, insulted by your question

187.speaker: Mystic Carrion
187.text: Hmm. They were... displeased when you refused them. But we may see if they are willing to forgive.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I'd like to learn what the spirits know about 'The Necromancy of Thay'. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
31.context: NodeContext: Correcting you, insulted by your question

371.speaker: Player
371.text: I'm trying to help your customer Oskar. He's been possessed.
371.context: NodeContext: Correcting you, insulted by your question

296.speaker: Player
296.text: That's it? You don't want to punish me for killing everyone upstairs?
296.context: NodeContext: Correcting you, insulted by your question

107.speaker: Mystic Carrion
107.text: In a city like this, reeking with the desperation of the damned, they are not difficult to replace.
107.context: NodeContext: Correcting you, insulted by your question

29.speaker: Mystic Carrion
29.text: I am a spirit medium, one capable of bridging the void between the living and the unliving, this plane and the next.
29.context: NodeContext: Correcting you, insulted by your question

75.speaker: Mystic Carrion
75.text: You do not possess the aptitude to attempt such a journey. Nor are you the calibre of client I would usually offer to escort.
75.context: NodeContext: At first curious, then snobbish, judging your use of the Speak with Dead spell

2.speaker: Mystic Carrion
2.text: You possess some aptitude in that regard, but I'm afraid you aren't of the calibre required to be one of my regular clients.
2.context: NodeContext: At first curious, then snobbish, judging your use of the Speak with Dead spell

440.speaker: Player
440.text: How did a medium end up in Baldur's Gate?
440.context: NodeContext: At first curious, then snobbish, judging your use of the Speak with Dead spell

324.speaker: Mystic Carrion
324.text: My story has been eternities in the making. Were I to recount it, you would return to dust before I finished the first sentence.

272.speaker: Mystic Carrion
272.text: As for why I chose this place as my home - it is a city rife with anguish, rippling with disturbed spiritual energy.

246.speaker: Mystic Carrion
246.text: The people here required a reassuring hand to navigate such waters, and so I offered mine.

273.speaker: Player
273.text: What kinds of clients do you accept?
273.context: NodeContext: At first curious, then snobbish, judging your use of the Speak with Dead spell

253.speaker: Mystic Carrion
253.text: Only a very select few, taken from the highest reaches of society.

291.speaker: Mystic Carrion
291.text: I find them to be far more appreciative of my services than the average mourner. And far more generous in paying for them.

235.speaker: Player
235.text: So you take advantage of the rich and the vulnerable?

333.speaker: Mystic Carrion
333.text: What are a few trinkets on the Material Plane when they could let you converse with a beloved mother? Or grant you vengeance where the justice of this world has faltered?

426.speaker: Mystic Carrion
426.text: I am hardly to blame for the inequalities at play in this city. My price is fair - it is not for I to decide who can afford it.

197.speaker: Mystic Carrion
197.text: You, for instance, cannot. And so I fear we have nothing left to discuss.

354.speaker: Player
354.text: The dead divulge their secrets to me readily enough.
354.context: NodeContext: At first curious, then snobbish, judging your use of the Speak with Dead spell

17.speaker: Mystic Carrion
17.text: Is that so? Yes, I see... A brief and superficial incantation, cast by only the crudest of magicians.
17.context: NodeContext: At first curious, then snobbish, judging your use of the Speak with Dead spell

442.speaker: Mystic Carrion
442.text: No customer of mine would ever settle for such parlour tricks. Nor would they pay for them.
442.context: NodeContext: Snobbish, judging your use of the spell

269.speaker: Mystic Carrion
269.text: If that is the sum of your curiosity, then I'm afraid we have nothing more to discuss. In this life, at least.
269.context: NodeContext: Trying to bring the conversation to a close

143.speaker: Mystic Carrion
143.text: Unless, of course, you are looking for a job.
143.context: NodeContext: with a smile - reminded of a cruel joke he played

111.speaker: Player
111.text: I came to discuss your client Oskar. He's been possessed.
111.context: NodeContext: with a smile - reminded of a cruel joke he played

98.speaker: Mystic Carrion
98.text: The painter. Yes, I remember. He wanted to contact a tormented spirit.
98.context: NodeContext: with a smile - reminded of a cruel joke he played

16.speaker: Mystic Carrion
16.text: I gave him exactly what he desired, and for a pittance, given the complexity of his request.

192.speaker: Mystic Carrion
192.text: His inability to follow simple instructions is hardly my fault. If he wanted his safety guaranteed, that would have cost him extra.
192.context: NodeContext: shocked that he might be considered to blame

233.speaker: Player
233.text: Who was he trying to contact?
233.context: NodeContext: A point of pride - he would never betray them (slimy)

391.speaker: Mystic Carrion
391.text: My clients are guaranteed absolute privacy in their consultations with myself and my spirits.
391.context: NodeContext: A point of pride - he would never betray them (slimy)

153.speaker: Player
153.text: How can he be freed of the spirit possessing him?
153.context: NodeContext: with a dramatic sigh - woe is me

132.speaker: Mystic Carrion
132.text: It's quite simple. He requires an exorcism.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: His foolishness did not merit such a cruel punishment.
180.context: NodeContext: with a dramatic sigh - woe is me

276.speaker: Mystic Carrion
276.text: Idiocy punishes itself. My instructions were clear, as were the consequences of ignoring them.
276.context: NodeContext: with a dramatic sigh - woe is me

342.speaker: Mystic Carrion
342.text: My soft heart is to blame. I was too charitable in offering him my services so cheaply. He was clearly not capable.
342.context: NodeContext: with a dramatic sigh - woe is me

120.speaker: Player
120.text: So if he were richer, you would have protected him?

168.speaker: Mystic Carrion
168.text: Of course. That's what my clients pay for - to feel safe and superior, even over death itself.

206.speaker: Mystic Carrion
206.text: Oskar couldn't afford one tenth of my usual fees. I was indulgent in helping him, but now the spirit must be exorcised.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: You knew exactly what would happen. You torment him intentionally.

205.speaker: Mystic Carrion
205.text: Had he followed my instructions, he would never have been harmed.

55.speaker: Mystic Carrion
55.text: I assume you came to me seeking an exorcism?

435.speaker: Mystic Carrion
435.text: I can provide you with the means to perform such a ceremony, but you understand, this is my livelihood. First, you must do something for me.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Can't I just pay you instead?

351.speaker: Mystic Carrion
351.text: So ready to part with your gold to save yourself the bother of helping someone.

158.speaker: Mystic Carrion
158.text: Perhaps you are more like my usual customers than I thought.

189.speaker: Mystic Carrion
189.text: Very well - you may purchase Oskar's salvation. If you can afford it. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_4_5dac5eea-faeb-459c-b675-46c51519b784])
189.context: NodeContext: A bit pissed off, but still wants to work with you

458.speaker: Player
458.text: On second thoughts, tell me what you need.
458.context: NodeContext: Callous, indifferent to Thrumbo's death

299.speaker: Mystic Carrion
299.text: Do as I have asked. Return Thrumbo's body to me, and I will help your painter friend.
299.context: NodeContext: Callous, indifferent to Thrumbo's death

240.speaker: Mystic Carrion
240.text: A fair offer, given the boy only has himself to blame.

339.speaker: Mystic Carrion
339.text: Do not worry - it is of an earthly nature. It regards a conduit of mine, Thrumbo, who has recently deserted his duties.
339.context: NodeContext: Callous, indifferent to Thrumbo's death

290.speaker: Mystic Carrion
290.text: He has not gone far, but given the sensitivity of his nature, I would prefer that he is not free to roam the city.
290.context: NodeContext: Callous, indifferent to Thrumbo's death

380.speaker: Mystic Carrion
380.text: Return Thrumbo's body to me. Then I will give you what you need to cleanse Oskar of his spectral interloper.
380.context: NodeContext: Callous, indifferent to Thrumbo's death

210.speaker: Player
210.text: First, tell me why he ran.
210.context: NodeContext: Callous, indifferent to Thrumbo's death

346.speaker: Mystic Carrion
346.text: It's quite simple: he resented having to work for a living. The undead can be rather lazy in that regard.
346.context: NodeContext: Callous, indifferent to Thrumbo's death

100.speaker: Mystic Carrion
100.text: He was always a simple, contented creature - a beggar to the bone. Perhaps he has forgotten how ungenerous the world can be, or simply prefers to live in the gutter.
100.context: NodeContext: Callous, indifferent to Thrumbo's death

110.speaker: Mystic Carrion
110.text: If he does not value the gift I gave in reanimating that wretched flesh of his, then I will take it back. It is my property, not his.
110.context: NodeContext: Callous, indifferent to Thrumbo's death

281.speaker: Player
281.text: I already killed your runaway. Here's his body.
281.context: NodeContext: Dismissive - couldn't care less what happens to the other three

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Your runaway is already dead, but I can give you this jar I found in his body.
99.context: NodeContext: Dismissive - couldn't care less what happens to the other three

300.speaker: Mystic Carrion
300.text: A most prescient guest you are. And of course, such an offering must be repaid in kind.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Baldur's Gate is a big city. A name's not much to go on.
24.context: NodeContext: Dismissive - couldn't care less what happens to the other three

113.speaker: Mystic Carrion
113.text: Had I thought you were the type to shout his name from the rooftops, I never would have offered you the job.
113.context: NodeContext: Dismissive - couldn't care less what happens to the other three

106.speaker: Mystic Carrion
106.text: Thrumbo is not alone in his ingratitude - he has led others in my service astray. Three of them - beggars and zombies alike.
106.context: NodeContext: Dismissive - couldn't care less what happens to the other three

249.speaker: Mystic Carrion
249.text: The others lack even Thrumbo's modicum of intelligence. It should be no great task to wring his location from one of them.
249.context: NodeContext: Dismissive - couldn't care less what happens to the other three

254.speaker: Player
254.text: Very well. I'll bring you Thrumbo. You agree to free Oskar.

455.speaker: Mystic Carrion
455.text: Then, with the spirits herein our witnesses - the arrangement is made.

257.speaker: Mystic Carrion
257.text: Three others escaped with him, though they lack even Thrumbo's modicum of intelligence. They can no doubt point you in his direction.

12.speaker: Mystic Carrion
12.text: They will follow your progress with great interest. As will I.

247.speaker: Player
247.text: I'd rather just pay the gold. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_4_5dac5eea-faeb-459c-b675-46c51519b784])
247.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player pays the gold, and in return Mystic Carrion hands them the Torch of Revocation

11.speaker: Mystic Carrion
11.text: Then the Torch of Revocation is yours to use.
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player pays the gold, and in return Mystic Carrion hands them the Torch of Revocation

416.speaker: Mystic Carrion
416.text: I hope he is grateful for the price you paid to help him. Generosity like yours should never go unrewarded.
416.context: NodeContext: Like he knows something you don't (the spirit you exorcise from Oskar will attack you)

216.speaker: Mystic Carrion
216.text: Your purse is deeper than I thought. But wait -
216.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player hands Carrion the gold. After taking the gold, Carrion stops, as though listening to somethign the player cannot hear...NodeContext: Carrion stops after his line, as if listening to something we cannot hear

353.speaker: Mystic Carrion
353.text: Strange. My spirits witnessed thieving hands snatching up the very item I wished to give - the Torch of Revocation.
353.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion's focus returns to the player, unimpressedNodeContext: Tilts his head and looks at the player, unphased

434.speaker: Mystic Carrion
434.text: As you have paid for your indiscretion, we shall leave the matter at that. Now - get out.
434.context: NodeContext: A little pissed off, but still feeling he won the exchange with you

167.speaker: Player
167.text: I need time to think about this.
167.context: NodeContext: Feigning confusion - why ever would you refuse?

87.speaker: Mystic Carrion
87.text: A simple errand seems no price at all for the soul of your artist friend.
87.context: NodeContext: Feigning confusion - why ever would you refuse?

129.speaker: Mystic Carrion
129.text: Take time to consider my offer, if that is what you require. I'm sure Oskar has plenty to spare.

10.speaker: Mystic Carrion
10.text: Do not think on it too long, lest my offer be rescinded.
10.context: NodeContext: A bit pissed off - you wasted his time making him explain this. Now treating you like the help, not a customer

348.speaker: Player
348.text: No way. I'm not getting involved.

234.speaker: Mystic Carrion
234.text: A rash decision - one you will no doubt come to regret.

363.speaker: Mystic Carrion
363.text: When you have the stomach for the work, you are welcome to return.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: I might be able to help. For a fee, of course.
126.context: NodeContext: Considering - hasn't yet made his mind up

115.speaker: Mystic Carrion
115.text: I am more than able to offer you suitable recompense for such a task.
115.context: NodeContext: Considering - hasn't yet made his mind up

195.speaker: Mystic Carrion
195.text: An item, perhaps. One that resonates with your spiritual energies. The spirits will help me decide, once the task is performed.
195.context: NodeContext: Considering - hasn't yet made his mind up

388.speaker: Mystic Carrion
388.text: First, you must bring me Thrumbo's body.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: You speak of owning Thrumbo - are you his patron?

239.speaker: Mystic Carrion
239.text: I would not form a pact with a creature as base as Thrumbo. He is but a lost tool - one I wish to have returned.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Absolutely not. I won't help you with this.

260.speaker: Player
260.text: His 'body'? It sounds like you want him killed.

448.speaker: Mystic Carrion
448.text: My child, that would be asking the impossible. He is already dead.

384.speaker: Mystic Carrion
384.text: He is, what do they call them here... ah, a zombie. A waif I rescued from the jaws of death, and gave a second chance at earthly purpose.
384.context: NodeContext: At first, racking his brain - trying to recall the term to use in this time and place. Then grandiose.

343.speaker: Player
343.text: I'll need to think about it.

449.speaker: Player
449.text: So you won't just do it out of the goodness of your heart?

36.speaker: Mystic Carrion
36.text: I'm afraid my heart simply isn't in it.

320.speaker: Mystic Carrion
320.text: My professional services are available to you, should you be prepared to do something for me. The choice is entirely yours.

436.speaker: Player
436.text: I'll figure it out for myself.

62.speaker: Mystic Carrion
62.text: Some spiritual materials, though not much within reach of your purse, I fear.

225.speaker: Player
225.text: Is there anything I can do for you?
225.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion raises one hand to his head, as though channeling spirits. A strange wind whistles through the chamber. The light flickers, as though a presence is making itself known.NodeContext: Considering. Carrion, now standing, raises his staff  and puts his other hand on his temple for concentration.

201.speaker: Mystic Carrion
201.text: Hmmm. Yes, my spirits stir. They think you might be capable.
201.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion raises one hand to his head, as though channeling spirits. A strange wind whistles through the chamber. The light flickers, as though a presence is making itself known.NodeContext: Considering. Carrion, now standing, raises his staff  and puts his other hand on his temple for concentration.

96.speaker: Mystic Carrion
96.text: Very well. You may help me with a small matter.

15.speaker: Mystic Carrion
15.text: I have an assistant, Thrumbo - a conduit I use to maintain my connections with the Ethereal Plane. Unfortunately, he has deserted his duties.

444.speaker: Mystic Carrion
444.text: Return Thrumbo's body to me, and I will see that you are suitably compensated.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: You must be very selective. I've never heard anyone mention you.
25.context: NodeContext: warning, but with a smile (not a prelude to combat)

142.speaker: Mystic Carrion
142.text: My name is known to those who matter. So is my discretion.
142.context: NodeContext: warning, but with a smile (not a prelude to combat)

124.speaker: Mystic Carrion
124.text: The living hold such superstition about communing with the dead. As such, my patrons prefer to use my services in the strictest confidence.
124.context: NodeContext: warning, but with a smile (not a prelude to combat)

89.speaker: Player
89.context: NodeContext: warning, but with a smile (not a prelude to combat)

188.speaker: Mystic Carrion
188.text: Whatever the customer desires. Or at least, whatever they can afford.

407.speaker: Mystic Carrion
407.text: Each brings their own desperation. Some crave a word of solace, some wish to see, to summon, to torment - I provide for them all, according to their merit.

337.speaker: Mystic Carrion
337.text: You are not deserving of such a gift. Unless you've some other purpose here, our consultation is at an end.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Don't worry. I'm not here to interfere.
88.context: NodeContext: warning, but with a smile (not a prelude to combat)

250.speaker: Mystic Carrion
250.text: My spirits will make sure of it.
250.context: NodeContext: warning, but with a smile (not a prelude to combat)

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Halls of kings would hold upon my every honeyed word - what do you know of my calibre?

415.speaker: Mystic Carrion
415.text: However saccharine your words might be, I assure you they aren't to my tastes.

161.speaker: Player
161.text: I am a Ravengard. My lineage is beyond reproach.

155.speaker: Mystic Carrion
155.text: Lineage alone does not earn you the right to my services. I've turned away bluer blood than yours.

181.speaker: Player
181.text: 'Mystic Carrion'? Are you some kind of fortune-teller?
181.context: NodeContext: Pissed off but in control

395.speaker: Mystic Carrion
395.context: NodeContext: Pissed off but in control

400.speaker: Player
400.text: What other services do you provide?
400.context: NodeContext: Impressing his importance/power on you, but maintaing a sense of mystery

196.speaker: Player
196.text: What kind of appointments do you offer?
196.context: NodeContext: Impressing his importance/power on you, but maintaing a sense of mystery

79.speaker: Mystic Carrion
79.text: That depends on what torments you. Love. Vengeance. Regret.
79.context: NodeContext: Impressing his importance/power on you, but maintaing a sense of mystery

264.speaker: Mystic Carrion
264.text: The dead can be put to all sorts of purposes, in the hands of one adept at their manipulation.
264.context: NodeContext: Impressing his importance/power on you, but maintaing a sense of mystery

13.speaker: Mystic Carrion
13.text: I am a spirit medium, one who wanders the hazy boundaries of mortality bearing the intentions of the living, and the knowledge of the dead.
13.context: NodeContext: Impressing his importance/power on you, but maintaing a sense of mystery

323.speaker: Mystic Carrion
323.text: A naive interpretation of the forces at work beyond your perception. No wonder you sought a hand like mine to lead you through the darkness.

232.speaker: Mystic Carrion
232.text: What else could you require of Mystic Carrion when he has offered so much already?
232.context: NodeContext: Dismissive - not looking for an answer back

286.speaker: Mystic Carrion
286.text: What else could you require of Mystic Carrion when he has given so much already?
286.context: NodeContext: Dismissive - not looking for an answer back

154.speaker: Mystic Carrion
154.text: My client list is full. And you are not on it.
154.context: NodeContext: Dismissive - not looking for an answer back

319.speaker: Player
319.text: I'd like to hear what the spirits know about 'The Necromancy of Thay'. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])
319.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands gold over to Carrion. He receives it. (unseen)

350.speaker: Player
350.text: I'd like to hear what the spirits know about 'The Necromancy of Thay'. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
350.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands gold over to Carrion. He receives it. (unseen)

148.speaker: Player
148.text: I know you helped Oskar. I found your letter.
148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands gold over to Carrion. He receives it. (unseen)

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I still want to help Oskar. Tell me about the service you require.
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands gold over to Carrion. He receives it. (unseen)

263.speaker: Player
263.text: Here's your fee. Tell me how to help Oskar. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_4_5dac5eea-faeb-459c-b675-46c51519b784])
263.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands gold over to Carrion. He receives it. (unseen)

447.speaker: Mystic Carrion
447.text: A small price for the painter's salvation, I'm sure you'll agree.
447.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands gold over to Carrion. He receives it. (unseen)

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I came to offer my own services, if you've need of anything.

321.speaker: Player
321.text: Do you have anything to trade?

409.speaker: Mystic Carrion
409.text: Naturally. A few choice items for those seeking contact with the Ethereal planes.

410.speaker: Mystic Carrion
410.text: Feel free to return, so long as you can afford it.

271.speaker: Mystic Carrion
271.text: Feel free to return, so long as you can afford it.

417.speaker: Mystic Carrion
417.text: Hand his carcass to me. Quickly.
417.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion holds out his hands, expectantNodeContext: Hiding his urgency - he's eager to get back the canopic jar hidden inside. He holds out his hand expectantly

372.speaker: Player
372.text: Thrumbo seemed harmless enough to me.
372.context: NodeContext: Getting a little more urgent, annoyed that you're stalling.

267.speaker: Mystic Carrion
267.text: What he seemed to you and what he was to me are two entirely unrelated matters.
267.context: NodeContext: Getting a little more urgent, annoyed that you're stalling.

370.speaker: Mystic Carrion
370.text: I desired him to be returned to me, and you obliged, thus our terms have been met.
370.context: NodeContext: Getting a little more urgent, annoyed that you're stalling.

176.speaker: Mystic Carrion
176.text: Now - hand me his body. Stop wasting time.
176.context: NodeContext: Getting a little more urgent, annoyed that you're stalling.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I think it's time to renegotiate. I found the jar hidden in Thrumbo's corpse.
57.context: NodeContext: Edging towards a threat on the last part of the line

185.speaker: Player
185.context: NodeContext: Edging towards a threat on the last part of the line

399.speaker: Player
399.context: NodeContext: Edging towards a threat on the last part of the line

241.speaker: Player
241.text: I don't have his body, but will this jar suffice?
241.context: NodeContext: Edging towards a threat on the last part of the line

420.speaker: Mystic Carrion
420.text: Yes, that will be more than enough. A task most efficiently performed.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Not so fast. First, tell me about the reward you promised.
4.context: NodeContext: Edging towards a threat on the last part of the line

366.speaker: Mystic Carrion
366.text: It is a Torch of Revocation, a light used only to illuminate the darkest pathways of the damned.
366.context: NodeContext: Edging towards a threat on the last part of the line

50.speaker: Mystic Carrion
50.text: Few exist, and fewer still can be obtained for such a meagre price. It is a rare gift - one some in this city desperately require.
50.context: NodeContext: Edging towards a threat on the last part of the line

0.speaker: Mystic Carrion
0.text: Give me Thrumbo's flesh, and the Torch is yours.
0.context: NodeContext: Stern, not impressed that you're delayig the handover

419.speaker: Player
419.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player hands Thrumbo's body to Carrion (unseen). NodeContext: Carrion looks down at the corpse that's been thrown at his feet

313.speaker: Mystic Carrion
313.text: So, you choose to deceive me. What you have stolen, I will reclaim. And I will make your soul suffer for it.

26.speaker: Player
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player hands Thrumbo's body to Carrion (unseen). NodeContext: Carrion looks down at the corpse that's been thrown at his feet

27.speaker: Mystic Carrion
27.text: No more than the ungrateful cur deserved.
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player hands Thrumbo's body to Carrion (unseen). NodeContext: Carrion looks down at the corpse that's been thrown at his feet

102.speaker: Mystic Carrion
102.text: Take the Torch. Put it to whatever use you see fit.
102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.

9.speaker: Mystic Carrion
9.text: And what do you deserve? You sought the means to help sweet young Oskar, did you not?
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.

461.speaker: Mystic Carrion
461.text: I give you this Torch of Revocation.
461.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.

439.speaker: Mystic Carrion
439.text: And what do you deserve, I wonder, for meting out such justice?
439.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion listens, as though receiving an answer from a voice we cannot hear. Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.NodeContext: Carrion pauses and listens for a bit, before handing the player a torch

45.speaker: Mystic Carrion
45.text: Yes, of course. A Torch of Revocation. Fitting for one so adept at tracking down wayward souls.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion listens, as though receiving an answer from a voice we cannot hear. Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.NodeContext: Carrion pauses and listens for a bit, before handing the player a torch

28.speaker: Mystic Carrion
28.text: Is that so? I hear you already stole something of great value from me. And so, you deserve nothing more.
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion tilts his head, as though listening to a voice we cannot hear. His attention returns to the player, unimpressedNodeContext: Pissed off at you, but he got what he wanted so is letting it go. He tilts his head as if listening to a voice we cannot hear, then focuses back on the player

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Is that the going rate for canopic jars these days? I expected more.
152.context: NodeContext: Not impressed, hint of a threat

457.speaker: Mystic Carrion
457.text: This is your preferred course - to change the terms of our arrangement now that you feel you have the upper hand?
457.context: NodeContext: Not impressed, hint of a threat

53.speaker: Player
53.text: You know what, the Torch of Revocation is plenty.
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.

302.speaker: Mystic Carrion
302.text: Gratitude is a lesson some never learn. You were wise not to make me teach you.
302.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.

71.speaker: Mystic Carrion
71.text: The Torch will be more than enough to free your little painter friend of his unwanted occupier.
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.

252.speaker: Mystic Carrion
252.text: Use it to destroy the painting of his self-destructive lover, and her spirit will be forced to vacate his body.
252.context: NodeContext: Snappy, businesslike - he wants this conversation to be over

74.speaker: Mystic Carrion
74.text: And what prize do the spirits wish me to offer? Ah, yes. Take the Torch of Revocation. A generous reward for such a menial service.
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion listens, as though receiving an answer from a voice we cannot hear. Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.NodeContext: Carrion pauses and listens for a bit, before handing the player a torch

413.speaker: Mystic Carrion
413.text: With that, my debt to you is settled. Should you need any further consultations, you will, of course, have to pay for them.
413.context: NodeContext: Wrapping things up, unapologetic about returning to a mercantile relationship with you

231.speaker: Player
231.text: Not the hand, but the heart. So sweeten the deal, or I'll destroy the jar.
231.context: NodeContext: mildly amused - he doesn't really care about being blackmailed, only about getting the jar back

77.speaker: Mystic Carrion
77.text: You are a brave soul, to try and manipulate one who makes the dead dance from his fingertips.
77.context: NodeContext: mildly amused - he doesn't really care about being blackmailed, only about getting the jar back

182.speaker: Mystic Carrion
182.text: You are a brave soul, to try and manipulate one who makes the dead dance from his fingertips.
182.context: NodeContext: mildly amused - he doesn't really care about being blackmailed, only about getting the jar back

136.speaker: Mystic Carrion
136.text: Given his condition, I am willing to refund Oskar's original fee. But the Torch of Revocation is what you require to help him.
136.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.

441.speaker: Mystic Carrion
441.text: I can offer a small bonus payment, for services so capably rendered. With this and the Torch, my debt is amply paid.
441.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion hands over the Torch of Revocation. The player accepts.

198.speaker: Mystic Carrion
198.text: Such a tenacious spirit you possess. I do look forward to meeting it again.

59.text: How disappointing. I hoped Thrumbo's disobedience would die with him.
59.context: NodeContext: Commanding, angered, as though summoning spirits

344.speaker: Mystic Carrion
344.text: How disappointing. I hoped Thrumbo's disobedience would die with him.
344.context: NodeContext: Commanding, angered, as though summoning spirits

183.speaker: Mystic Carrion
183.text: Your corpse will surrender the jar to me. I will make it.
183.context: NodeContext: Commanding, angered, as though summoning spirits

35.context: CinematicNodeContext: The room flickers and whispers around Carrion, as though his spirits are becoming angry. He SLAMS his staff into the ground, unleashing a terrifying scream through the room.

202.speaker: Mystic Carrion
202.text: Your corpse will surrender his flesh to me. I will make it.
202.context: NodeContext: Commanding, angered, as though summoning spirits

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Come now - what's a handful of gold when your life is at stake?

338.speaker: Player
338.text: Hmmm... no. Sorry, changed my mind.

310.speaker: Player
310.text: I've decided to keep it. The smell isn't so bad once you get used to it.

133.speaker: Mystic Carrion
133.text: I see you fulfilled our agreement, and with admirable gusto.
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player's approach, Carrion raises a hand, as though silencing voices we cannot hear.

186.speaker: Mystic Carrion
186.text: No more than the ungrateful cur deserved.

140.speaker: Mystic Carrion
140.text: You do not have an appointment.
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion stands still, almost trance-like at his throne. The player approaches, but he does not seem aware of their presence, then - BANG. He slams his staff on the ground.NodeContext: Firm, irritated

184.speaker: Mystic Carrion
184.text: My spirits told me you were capable, yet you stand in my presence, and Thrumbo is nowhere to be seen...

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I came to speak to you about your customer Oskar. He's been possessed.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Do you have anything to trade?

85.speaker: Mystic Carrion
85.text: But of course. One must never be scared to part with gold - it's better spent than buried.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I let him go. You'd be wise to do the same.

46.speaker: Mystic Carrion
46.text: So you choose to leave him a vagrant, destined to be swept from the gutters and discarded?

358.speaker: Mystic Carrion
358.text: I gave him safety. I gave him purpose. More than any soul gave him in his mortal lifetime.

7.speaker: Mystic Carrion
7.text: He is bound to me, as I am bound to him. His freedom was never yours to decide.

280.speaker: Player
280.text: What do you mean? What binds you to him?

294.speaker: Mystic Carrion
294.text: Nothing a short-lived creature like yourself would understand.

386.speaker: Mystic Carrion
386.text: His existence is a mere extension of my own - he lives and dies with me.

379.speaker: Mystic Carrion
379.text: You do not get to decide the fates of others. You have earned no such right.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: He can decide his own fate, once I've put you back in the grave for good.

423.speaker: Mystic Carrion
423.text: You think I would die so easily? You think Thrumbo would live? Fool.

268.speaker: Player
268.text: I couldn't care less what happens to him. I'm washing my hands of this rotten business.

274.speaker: Mystic Carrion
274.text: You ignored my instructions, defied me in favour of that half-wit beggar boy.

72.speaker: Mystic Carrion
72.text: Perhaps you will prove more competent once I unshackle your spirit from that useless flesh of yours.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: Some family ties are meant to be broken.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: Foul creature. I will cleanse your stain from this place.

282.speaker: Player
282.text: I've had a change of heart. It's your carcass I'm interested in.

94.speaker: Mystic Carrion
94.text: Is that so? You realise, without me your painter friend hasn't a hope of regaining control of his body.

427.speaker: Mystic Carrion
427.text: You'd condemn Oskar to such a fate, all over the words of a soulless ingrate?

381.speaker: Player
381.text: I don't need you. I'll find another way to help Oskar.

289.speaker: Player
289.text: Had you any concern for Oskar's fate, you'd have helped him already.
289.context: NodeContext: Malicious, gleeful - knew exactly what would happen

34.speaker: Mystic Carrion
34.context: NodeContext: Malicious, gleeful - knew exactly what would happen

76.speaker: Mystic Carrion
76.text: His body is chained to that spirit for eternity. I forged the links myself.
76.context: NodeContext: Malicious, gleeful - knew exactly what would happen

237.speaker: Mystic Carrion
237.text: Perhaps you'd care for some bindings of your own. I know plenty of spectres who'd kill to possess a body like yours.
237.context: NodeContext: Commanding, angered, as though summoning spirits

238.speaker: Player
238.text: One soul is no great sacrifice to stop someone like you.

49.speaker: Mystic Carrion
49.text: And you believe yourself capable of passing such a judgement?

211.speaker: Mystic Carrion
211.text: It must be a fine thing when one's moral compass points so unwaveringly towards righteousness.

91.speaker: Mystic Carrion
91.text: Let us see if it can guide your spirit through the realms of the dead.

456.speaker: Player
456.text: I've condemned better people over less.

78.speaker: Mystic Carrion
78.text: I know. I've heard them screaming for you.

256.speaker: Mystic Carrion
256.text: So many souls waiting for you to join them. Wanting to hurt. To harm. To have their revenge.

200.speaker: Mystic Carrion
200.text: I think it's time you joined them.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: 'Soulless' is a bold word for an unholy creature like you.

138.speaker: Mystic Carrion
138.text: So quick to brand another as 'unholy'.

265.speaker: Mystic Carrion
265.text: So, Thrumbo's filled your head with tales of woe, and yet still he misses the point entirely. Both of you do.

130.speaker: Mystic Carrion
130.text: Thrumbo is a part of me, and I am part of him. He can no more escape me than a fly can escape the spider's web. He is mine. Forever.

304.speaker: Player
304.text: Terribly sorry but I seem to have, erm, misplaced it.

162.speaker: Mystic Carrion
162.text: I see Thrumbo's idiocy is contagious.

316.speaker: Mystic Carrion
316.text: Hush, spirits - I sense it too. Our guest brings with them the stench of Thrumbo's disobedience.
316.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player's approach, Carrion raises a hand, as though silencing voices we cannot hear.

317.speaker: Mystic Carrion
317.text: A strange offering... yet exactly the one I desired. My spirits did well to whisper my intentions in your ears.
317.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player's approach, Carrion raises a hand, as though silencing voices we cannot hear.

378.speaker: Mystic Carrion
378.text: You have my thanks for bringing Thrumbo back to me.

327.speaker: Mystic Carrion
327.text: You do not have an appointment. Yet you seek an audience with Mystic Carrion...
327.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion stands still, almost trance-like at his throne. The player approaches, but he does not seem aware of their presence, then - BANG. He slams his staff on the ground.

30.speaker: Mystic Carrion
30.text: Ah. I sense you have trodden the paths of the dead, felt their bones crumble to dust beneath your feet.
30.context: NodeContext: A flash of recognition - he's figured it out

430.speaker: Mystic Carrion
430.text: You are familiar with 'The Necromancy of Thay'.

220.speaker: Mystic Carrion
220.text: Ah, yes. You were drawn to me. A wanderer bearing the scent of death. You are familiar with 'The Necromancy of Thay'.
220.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion leans forward, curious. NodeContext: Leans forward, curious

259.speaker: Mystic Carrion
259.text: I have heard the spirits whisper its name. Few books have the power to send a shiver through the living and the dead.

244.speaker: Mystic Carrion
244.text: Tell me, what did you make of its contents?

454.speaker: Player
454.text: You're familiar with the subject matter?

73.speaker: Mystic Carrion
73.text: Such a book is for those who make only the shallowest ripples in death's dark pools. I inhabit the depths.

398.speaker: Mystic Carrion
398.text: Still, such powers are not without danger when wielded by one of your... capabilities.
398.context: NodeContext: Subtly insulting, 'capabilities' as though he believe you're incapable

432.speaker: Mystic Carrion
432.text: Clearly these are not waters you know how to swim in. I would hate to be the one who helps you drown.
432.context: NodeContext: Subtly insulting, 'capabilities' as though he believe you're incapable

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Oh yes, I loved it. Especially the part about the unicorns.

95.speaker: Mystic Carrion
95.text: Those with more... sanguine natures are rarely attuned to the Ethereal Plane, or ready to receive its wisdom -
95.context: NodeContext: Subtly insulting, dismissing you as unimportant until the spirits interrupt -

355.speaker: Mystic Carrion
355.text: Ah - but wait. My spirits stir. Our conversation appears to have... disturbed them.
355.context: CinematicNodeContext: A strange wind seems to blow through the chamber. The player looks for the cause, but sees nothing. Carrion puts up a hand ('pause/silence' gesture), tilting his head as though listening to something we cannot hear, then speaksNodeContext: Carrion puts up a hand to silence voices, as though hearing someone interrupting (the player hears nothing), and slightly tilts his head

159.speaker: Mystic Carrion
159.text: They have a message for you. A most valuable one. I can summon them forth, if you are willing to offer them suitable recompense. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
159.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion raises his staff, putting his other hand to his temple in concentration - he is communing with the spirit realm. The room darkens, the only light a sickly glow over Carrion's form.NodeContext: Carrion, now standing, raises his staff  and puts his other hand on his temple for concentration. Calling out to the room/ghosts. Slightly for the benefit of the player watching him

405.speaker: Player
405.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion raises his staff, putting his other hand to his temple in concentration - he is communing with the spirit realm. The room darkens, the only light a sickly glow over Carrion's form.NodeContext: Carrion, now standing, raises his staff  and puts his other hand on his temple for concentration. Calling out to the room/ghosts. Slightly for the benefit of the player watching him

288.speaker: Player
288.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion raises his staff, putting his other hand to his temple in concentration - he is communing with the spirit realm. The room darkens, the only light a sickly glow over Carrion's form.NodeContext: Carrion, now standing, raises his staff  and puts his other hand on his temple for concentration. Calling out to the room/ghosts. Slightly for the benefit of the player watching him

431.speaker: Mystic Carrion
431.text: Spirits, Mystic Carrion calls on you. Come forth. Listen. Obey.
431.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mystic Carrion raises his staff, putting his other hand to his temple in concentration - he is communing with the spirit realm. The room darkens, the only light a sickly glow over Carrion's form.NodeContext: Carrion, now standing, raises his staff  and puts his other hand on his temple for concentration. Calling out to the room/ghosts. Slightly for the benefit of the player watching him

21.speaker: Mystic Carrion
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: A loud BANG. The player looks into the darkness, but sees nothing there. Carrion has not moved.NodeContext: Quieter, addressed to the player (without physically turning to them)

245.speaker: Mystic Carrion
245.text: Yes. They know of 'The Necromancy of Thay'. They fear it. They do not want its power released -
245.context: CinematicNodeContext: Two BANGS. Carrion's head snaps back, as though controlled by something else. He's channelling the spirits.NodeContext: Carrion's head snaps back. he talks as he's possessed. Hisses, as though multiple voices, different ages and genders, are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through. he seems controlled by something else as he speaks.

82.speaker: Mystic Carrion
82.text: Death... destruction... decay... The book must remain sealed.
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Two BANGS. Carrion's head snaps back, as though controlled by something else. He's channelling the spirits.NodeContext: Carrion's head snaps back. he talks as he's possessed. Hisses, as though multiple voices, different ages and genders, are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through. he seems controlled by something else as he speaks.

352.speaker: Player
352.text: Fear not, spirits. My interests in the book are purely academic.
352.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion's staff slides out to the side, as though moved by an unseen hand. He continues to grip it tightly,NodeContext: Channelling. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

227.speaker: Mystic Carrion
227.text: Perhaps... can be trusted... perhaps... this one is different...
227.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion's staff slides out to the side, as though moved by an unseen hand. He continues to grip it tightly,NodeContext: Channelling. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

40.speaker: Mystic Carrion
40.text: Perhaps... can be trusted... perhaps... this one is different...
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion's staff slides out to the side, as though moved by an unseen hand. He continues to grip it tightly,NodeContext: Channelling. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

223.speaker: Mystic Carrion
223.context: NodeContext: Channelling. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

203.speaker: Mystic Carrion
203.text: Seek it... seek it. SEEK IT.
203.context: NodeContext: Channelling. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

275.text: It seems that if you want to unlock the mysteries of the Necromancy, you must find the 'Tharchiate Codex'.
275.context: CinematicNodeContext: The spirits depart, whistling as though a terrible wind blows through. Then BANG - they are gone, and the atmosphere lifts. Carrion returns to his relaxed pose.

108.speaker: Mystic Carrion
108.text: It seems that if you want to unlock the mysteries of the Necromancy, you must find the 'Tharchiate Codex'.
108.context: NodeContext: As though he knows something/is holding something back.

226.speaker: Mystic Carrion
226.text: A simple ask for such a potent prize.
226.context: NodeContext: As though he knows something/is holding something back.

349.speaker: Player
349.context: NodeContext: An idle warning, not really trying to stop you

230.speaker: Mystic Carrion
230.text: A necromantic grimoire of some repute, mostly ill.

318.speaker: Player
318.text: The spirits took some persuading. You're sure their advice can be trusted?
318.context: NodeContext: An idle warning, not really trying to stop you

397.speaker: Mystic Carrion
397.text: Those who would breach the bounds of life and death must be willing to defy the doctrines of those on both sides.
397.context: NodeContext: An idle warning, not really trying to stop you

105.speaker: Mystic Carrion
105.text: The spirits provided you with the knowledge required. That is all that matters.
105.context: NodeContext: An idle warning, not really trying to stop you

147.speaker: Mystic Carrion
147.text: If a copy of the 'Tharchiate Codex' has entered this city, it will rest on their shelves.
147.context: NodeContext: An idle warning, not really trying to stop you

217.speaker: Mystic Carrion
217.text: Be warned. 'The Necromancy of Thay' is not a book for idle study. I share my spirits' concerns about your aptitude for such knowledge.
217.context: NodeContext: An idle warning, not really trying to stop you

172.speaker: Mystic Carrion
172.text: Alas, and further education on the subject would cost far more than you are able to pay.

261.speaker: Mystic Carrion
261.text: Now, unless you have any further business with me - I think this consultation has reached its end.

334.speaker: Mystic Carrion
334.text: I always have items of interest to those of a curious disposition.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Reading two books? Sounds complicated to me.
1.context: NodeContext: With a smile - amused at the thought of the trial awaiting you

43.speaker: Mystic Carrion
43.text: I see you were gifted with the courage to stare into death's darkest corners, but not the intelligence to understand it.

144.speaker: Mystic Carrion
144.text: It does not matter. The magic at work here does not require your comprehension. Only your participation.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: A necromancer's secrets are hard won. There's more to this than a simple codex.
48.context: NodeContext: With a smile - amused at the thought of the trial awaiting you

336.speaker: Mystic Carrion
336.text: Collaboration is rarely second nature to your kind. But who knows, the writer of this particular tome may have been feeling generous.
336.context: NodeContext: With a smile - amused at the thought of the trial awaiting you

151.speaker: Mystic Carrion
151.text: I might seek out their spirit and ask them. As for you - you must seek the Codex.
151.context: NodeContext: With a smile - amused at the thought of the trial awaiting you

266.speaker: Player
266.text: That's what worries me. This seems too easy.

359.speaker: Mystic Carrion
359.text: Perhaps the writer of this tome was a particularly generous necromancer. Or perhaps they had other motives for allowing it to be read so easily.

218.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion's staff slides out to the side, as though moved by an unseen hand. He continues to grip it tightly,NodeContext: Channelling. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

329.speaker: Mystic Carrion
329.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrion's staff slides out to the side, as though moved by an unseen hand. He continues to grip it tightly,NodeContext: Channelling. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

361.speaker: Mystic Carrion
361.text: Leave it be... LEAVE IT BE...
361.context: NodeContext: Channelling, gaining in intensity and anger. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

373.speaker: Mystic Carrion
373.text: The spirits have spoken. 'The Necromancy of Thay' must go unread.
373.context: NodeContext: suppressing amusement - after all that, the player didn't get what they wanted

387.speaker: Player
387.text: You must have some idea of how the book can be opened?
387.context: NodeContext: Slight distaste - it isn't up to his standards

425.speaker: Player
425.text: I paid for that consultation. I expected an answer!
425.context: NodeContext: Slight distaste - it isn't up to his standards

150.speaker: Mystic Carrion
150.text: And an answer was provided. The dead are not obliged to provide the one you want.
150.context: NodeContext: Slight distaste - it isn't up to his standards

412.speaker: Mystic Carrion
412.text: There is a place. 'Sorcerous Sundries'. It is the closest to a necromantic emporium this city has to offer.
412.context: NodeContext: Slight distaste - it isn't up to his standards

32.speaker: Mystic Carrion
32.text: Go there. Speak with the proprietor. Perhaps they might sell the key to the book's opening.

403.speaker: Player
403.text: So be it. I have no desire to invoke the wrath of the dead.
403.context: NodeContext: Smirking - thinks you're an idiot

270.speaker: Mystic Carrion
270.text: Their wrath is one of their finer qualities. A valuable commodity when employed against a mortal enemy, for example.
270.context: NodeContext: Smirking - thinks you're an idiot

104.speaker: Mystic Carrion
104.text: Alas, you do not possess the stomach for such practices. Nor could you afford them if you did.
104.context: NodeContext: Smirking - thinks you're an idiot

325.speaker: Mystic Carrion
325.text: Still, you may find another purpose for the tome. A doorstop, perhaps.
325.context: NodeContext: Smirking - thinks you're an idiot

199.speaker: Player
199.text: Deny me, spectres, and I will unleash such torments you will beg to die again.
199.context: NodeContext: Channelling, fearful. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

331.context: NodeContext: Channelling, fearful. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

303.speaker: Mystic Carrion
303.context: NodeContext: Channelling, fearful. Hissed, as though multiple voices are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

360.speaker: Player
360.text: This knowledge is mine by right. You must obey.
360.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrio's head still snapped back - possession positionNodeContext: Channelling, gaining intensity. head still snaped back. Hissed, as though multiple voices, different ages and genders, are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

221.speaker: Player
221.text: I hear your warning, spirits. The book shall remain unread.
221.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrio's head still snapped back - possession positionNodeContext: Channelling, gaining intensity. head still snaped back. Hissed, as though multiple voices, different ages and genders, are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

248.speaker: Mystic Carrion
248.text: We have warned... heed us... never opened... NEVER.
248.context: CinematicNodeContext: Carrio's head still snapped back - possession positionNodeContext: Channelling, gaining intensity. head still snaped back. Hissed, as though multiple voices, different ages and genders, are speaking through him. It cuts in and out, as though only part of the message is coming through

56.speaker: Mystic Carrion
56.text: A shame. You could have taken what you needed from them. They are easily controlled.
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Another BANG and the spirits depart. The atmosphere lifts. Carrion returns to his relaxed pose.

135.speaker: Mystic Carrion
135.text: 'Safety' is a concept immaterial to the spectral planes.

285.speaker: Mystic Carrion
285.text: It is sufficient to say - you will not be harmed.

298.speaker: Player
298.text: Let me guess - my dead grandmother wants to tell me she loves me?

121.speaker: Mystic Carrion
121.text: Oh, no. She has forgotten you entirely.

228.speaker: Mystic Carrion
228.text: This message comes from spirits I have collected. Those with great knowledge in life, great wealth, great purpose. It is far more valuable.

438.speaker: Player
438.text: Come now - surely you can offer a better price for one who shares your respect for the dead?
438.context: NodeContext: amused at your haggling, doesn't really respect you

392.speaker: Mystic Carrion
392.context: NodeContext: amused at your haggling, doesn't really respect you

357.speaker: Mystic Carrion
357.text: Very well. A small discount, as a mark of respect for our mutual expertise. Pay, and I will relay their message. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])
357.context: NodeContext: amused at your haggling, doesn't really respect you

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Sounds like a waste of gold to me.
83.context: NodeContext: unsurprised, never thought you were capable

340.speaker: Mystic Carrion
340.text: What a plague is the stubbornness of the living. Should you realise your mistake, feel free to return.
340.context: NodeContext: unsurprised, never thought you were capable

402.speaker: Mystic Carrion
402.text: Perhaps one day the book will reveal its secrets to you. Until then - they are best left between its covers.

277.speaker: Mystic Carrion
277.text: Unless you have any other business with me, I suggest you return to the domain of the living.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: If I could open it, I'd be glad to share an opinion. Unfortunately, it's shut tight.

175.speaker: Mystic Carrion
175.text: Sealed against those who lack the capability to understand it, no doubt.

396.speaker: Player
396.text: I haven't finished it. Somehow I cannot decipher the final pages.

312.speaker: Mystic Carrion
312.text: Is that so? Then the book's protections must be broken before its true nature can be understood.

179.speaker: Player
179.text: That book tried to kill me. Whatever's inside - it's bad news.

14.speaker: Mystic Carrion
14.text: Few possess the temperament required to gaze into death's abyss. Fewer still to reach in and take from it.

401.speaker: Mystic Carrion
401.text: Have we more business in this life? Can it not wait until the next?
401.context: NodeContext: Slightly bored - "why are you still here?"

293.speaker: Player
293.text: What really happened to Oskar's lover?
293.context: NodeContext: Couldn't care less about what happpened to her

443.speaker: Mystic Carrion
443.text: Oh, her death was most ordinary.
443.context: NodeContext: Couldn't care less about what happpened to her

122.speaker: Mystic Carrion
122.text: She killed herself. Obviously life was too heavy a burden. You'd be surprised how many aren't strong enough to bear it.
122.context: NodeContext: Couldn't care less about what happpened to her

118.speaker: Mystic Carrion
118.text: Of course, it was hardly my place to speculate on why she chose such a course. Only her spirit could tell you that.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: I met your customer Oskar. He's been possessed.
141.context: NodeContext: Knew this would happen, pleased by it

177.speaker: Mystic Carrion
177.context: NodeContext: Knew this would happen, pleased by it

322.speaker: Mystic Carrion
322.text: A simple enough matter to rectify with the Torch of Revocation I gave you.
322.context: NodeContext: Doesn't really care what happens

305.speaker: Mystic Carrion
305.text: After that, you can dispatch the spirit as you see fit. It should be well within your capabilities.
305.context: NodeContext: Doesn't really care what happens

332.speaker: Mystic Carrion
332.text: Let it not be said that Mystic Carrion does not take good care of his customers.

190.speaker: Mystic Carrion
190.text: Ah, I sense you too like to wander the boundaries between life and death. You have read 'The Necromancy of Thay'.
190.context: NodeContext: hint of mockery - the Necromancy of Thay is a children's book, as far as he's concerned

376.speaker: Mystic Carrion
376.text: Tell me, what brings one of such power into the presence of Mystic Carrion?
376.context: NodeContext: hint of mockery - the Necromancy of Thay is a children's book, as far as he's concerned

422.speaker: Mystic Carrion
422.text: If you are unwilling to help me, then I fear we have nothing more to discuss.
